REST API repository Contacts¶

async src.repository.contacts.create(body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The create function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Connect to the database

Returns:

A contact object

async src.repository.contacts.get_birthday_contacts(b_days: int, db: Session)¶

The get_birthday_contacts function returns a list of contacts whose birthday is within the next b_days days.

Parameters:

  • b_days – int: Determine how many days in advance the user wants to be notified

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthday is within the next b_days days

async src.repository.contacts.get_contact_id(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶
The get_contact_id function takes in a contact_id and db Session object,

queries the database for the contact with that id, and returns it.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact object of the given id

async src.repository.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int, offset: int, db: Session)¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts from the database.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of records to skip before returning results

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A list of contact objects

async src.repository.contacts.get_search_contacts(first_name: str, last_name: str, email: str, db: Session)¶
The get_search_contacts function searches the database for contacts that match the search criteria.

The function takes in a first name, last name, and email address as parameters. It then uses SQLAlchemy to query the database for any contacts that have a matching first or last name or email address. If no matches are found, an empty list is returned.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str: Filter the contacts by first name

  • last_name – str: Filter the contacts by last name

  • email – str: Search for contacts by email

  • db – Session: Pass the database session object to the function

Returns:

A list of contacts that match the search criteria

async src.repository.contacts.remove(contact_id: int, db: Session)¶

The remove function removes a contact from the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The contact that was deleted

Doc-author:

Trelent

async src.repository.contacts.update(contact_id: int, body: ContactModel, db: Session)¶

The update function updates a contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Specify which contact to delete

  • body – ContactModel: Update the contact with the new information

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A contact object

REST API repository Users¶

async src.repository.users.confirmed_email(email: str, db: Session) → None¶

The confirmed_email function takes in an email and a database session, and sets the confirmed field of the user with that email to True.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user to be confirmed

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

None

async src.repository.users.create_user(body: UserModel, db: Session) → User¶

The create_user function creates a new user in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Validate the data that is passed to the function

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.get_user_by_email(email: str, db: Session) → User | None¶

The get_user_by_email function takes in an email and a database session, and returns the user associated with that email. If no such user exists, it returns None.

Parameters:

  • email – str: Specify the email address of the user we want to retrieve

  • db – Session: Pass in the database session

Returns:

The user object if the email exists in the database

async src.repository.users.update_avatar(email, url: str, db: Session) → User¶

The update_avatar function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • email – Find the user in the database

  • url – str: Pass in the url of the avatar image

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

A user object

async src.repository.users.update_token(user: User, token: str | None, db: Session) → None¶

The update_token function updates the refresh token for a user.

Parameters:

  • user – User: Pass the user object to the function

  • token – str | None: Pass in the new token to be saved

  • db – Session: Commit the changes to the database

Returns:

None

REST API routes Auth¶

async src.routes.auth.confirmed_email(token: str, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The confirmed_email function is used to confirm a user’s email address.

It takes the token from the URL and uses it to get the user’s email address. The function then checks if there is a user with that email in our database, and if not, returns an error message. If there is a user with that email in our database, we check whether their account has already been confirmed or not. If it has been confirmed already, we return another error message saying so; otherwise we call repository_users’ confirmed_email function which sets the ‘confirmed’ field of that particular record to

Parameters:

  • token – str: Get the token from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

async src.routes.auth.login(body: OAuth2PasswordRequestForm = Depends(OAuth2PasswordRequestForm), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The login function is used to authenticate a user.

It takes the username and password from the request body, verifies that they are correct, and returns an access token.

Parameters:

  • body – OAuth2PasswordRequestForm: Validate the request body

  • db – Session: Access the database

Returns:

A token, which is then used to access the protected endpoints

async src.routes.auth.refresh_token(credentials: HTTPAuthorizationCredentials = Security(HTTPBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The refresh_token function is used to refresh the access token.

The function takes in a refresh token and returns an access_token, a new refresh_token, and the type of token. If the user’s current refresh_token does not match what was passed into this function then it will return an error.

Parameters:

  • credentials – HTTPAuthorizationCredentials: Get the token from the header

  • db – Session: Create a connection to the database

Returns:

A new access token and refresh token

async src.routes.auth.request_email(body: RequestEmail, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The request_email function is used to email to the user with a link that will allow them to confirm their account. The function takes in a RequestEmail object, which contains the email of the user who wants to confirm their account. It then checks if there is already a confirmed account with that email address, and if so returns an error message saying as much. If not, it sends an email containing a confirmation link.

Parameters:

  • body – RequestEmail: Validate the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks

  • request – Request: Get the base_url of the application

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A dictionary with a message

async src.routes.auth.signup(body: UserModel, background_tasks: BackgroundTasks, request: Request, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The signup function creates a new user in the database.

It takes a UserModel object as input, which is validated by pydantic. The password is hashed using Argon2 and stored in the database. An email with an activation link is sent to the user’s email address.

Parameters:

  • body – UserModel: Get the data from the request body

  • background_tasks – BackgroundTasks: Add a task to the background tasks queue

  • request – Request: Get the base url of the server

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A usermodel, which is the same as what it takes in

REST API routes Contacts¶

async src.routes.contacts.create_contact(body: ContactModel, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The create_contact function creates a new contact in the database.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

The created contact

async src.routes.contacts.delete_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The delete_contact function deletes a contact from the database.

It takes in an integer as a parameter, which is the ID of the contact to be deleted. The function returns a JSON object containing information about the deleted contact.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the id of the contact to be deleted

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _ – User: Ensure that the user is authenticated

Returns:

The deleted contact

async src.routes.contacts.get_contact(contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The get_contact function is used to retrieve a single contact from the database. It takes in an integer value for the contact_id, which is then passed into the get_contact_id function in rep_contacts.py, where it will be used to query for a specific contact in our database.

Parameters:

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact_id from the url

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _ – User: Ensure that the user is logged in

Returns:

An instance of the contact model

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts(limit: int = Query(10), offset: int = 0, db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The get_contacts function returns a list of contacts.

Parameters:

  • limit – int: Limit the number of contacts returned

  • le – Limit the number of contacts returned

  • offset – int: Specify the number of contacts to skip before returning

  • db – Session: Get the database session

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.get_contacts_birthday(day_to_birthday: int = 7, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The get_contacts_birthday function returns a list of contacts that have their birthday in the next 7 days.

The function takes an optional parameter day_to_birthday, which is set to 7 by default. If no contacts are found, it will return a 404 error.

Parameters:

  • day_to_birthday – int: Get the contacts whose birthday is in 7 days

  • db – Session: Get the database connection

  • _ – User: Get the current user

Returns:

A list of contacts whose birthdays are within a certain number of days

async src.routes.contacts.search(first_name: str | None = None, last_name: str | None = None, email: str | None = None, db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The search function allows the user to search for contacts by first name, last name, or email.

The function takes in a first_name (str), last_name (str), and email (str) as parameters. It returns a list of contacts that match the search criteria.

Parameters:

  • first_name – str | None: Specify the type of parameter that is expected

  • last_name – str | None: Specify that the last_name parameter is optional

  • email – str | None: Search for a contact by email

  • db – Session: Get the database session

  • _ – User: Get the current user from the auth_service

Returns:

A list of contacts

async src.routes.contacts.update_contact(body: ContactModel, contact_id: int = Path(Ellipsis), db: Session = Depends(get_db), _: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶
The update_contact function updates a contact in the database.

The function takes an id and a body as parameters, which are used to update the contact. If no such contact exists, it returns 404 Not Found.

Parameters:

  • body – ContactModel: Get the data from the request body

  • contact_id – int: Get the contact id from the path

  • db – Session: Get a database session

  • _ – User: Get the current user

Returns:

The updated contact object

REST API routes Users¶

async src.routes.users.read_users_me(current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user))¶

The read_users_me function is a GET endpoint that returns the current user’s information.

Parameters:

current_user – User: Pass the current user to the function

Returns:

The current user object

async src.routes.users.update_avatar_user(avatar: UploadFile = File(PydanticUndefined), current_user: User = Depends(get_current_user), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶

The update_avatar_user function updates the avatar of a user.

Parameters:

  • avatar – UploadFile: Receive the avatar file from the client

  • current_user – User: Get the current user

  • db – Session: Pass the database session to the function

Returns:

The updated user

REST API service Auth¶

class src.services.auth.Auth¶

Bases: object

ALGORITHM = 'HS256'¶
SECRET_KEY = 'secret_key'¶
async create_access_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_access_token function creates a new access token.

Parameters:

  • self – Access the class variables

  • data – dict: Pass the data that will be encoded in the jwt

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

A token that is encoded with the user’s data,

create_email_token(data: dict)¶

The create_email_token function takes a dictionary of data and returns a token. The token is created using the JWT library, which uses the SECRET_KEY and ALGORITHM to create an encoded string. The data dictionary contains information about the user’s email address, as well as when it was issued (iat) and when it expires (exp). The iat and exp values are added to the data dict before encoding.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • data – dict: Pass in the user’s email address and password

Returns:

A token that is encoded using the jwt library

async create_refresh_token(data: dict, expires_delta: float | None = None)¶

The create_refresh_token function creates a refresh token for the user.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • data – dict: Pass the user’s id and username to the function

  • expires_delta – Optional[float]: Set the expiration time of the token

Returns:

An encoded refresh token

async decode_refresh_token(refresh_token: str)¶

The decode_refresh_token function is used to decode the refresh token. It takes a refresh_token as an argument and returns the email of the user if it’s valid. If not, it raises an HTTPException with status code 401 (UNAUTHORIZED) and detail ‘Could not validate credentials’.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of a class

  • refresh_token – str: Pass the refresh token to the function

Returns:

The email of the user

async get_current_user(token: str = Depends(OAuth2PasswordBearer), db: Session = Depends(get_db))¶
The get_current_user function is a dependency that will be used in the

protected endpoints. It takes a token as an argument and returns the user if it’s valid, otherwise raises an HTTPException with status code 401.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the class

  • token – str: Get the token from the request header

  • db – Session: Get the database session, which is used to query the database

Returns:

A user object

async get_email_from_token(token: str)¶

The get_email_from_token function takes a token as an argument and returns the email address associated with that token. The function uses the jwt library to decode the token, which is then used to return the email address.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • token – str: Pass in the token that is generated by the create_access_token function

Returns:

The email address from the token

get_password_hash(password: str)¶

The get_password_hash function takes a password as input and returns the hash of that password. The hash is generated using the pwd_context object, which is an instance of Flask-Bcrypt’s Bcrypt class.

Parameters:

  • self – Represent the instance of the class

  • password – str: Define the password that is being hashed

Returns:

A hash of the password

oauth2_scheme = <fastapi.security.oauth2.OAuth2PasswordBearer object>¶
pwd_context = <CryptContext>¶
r = Redis<ConnectionPool<Connection<host=localhost,port=6379,db=0>>>¶
verify_password(plain_password, hashed_password)¶

The verify_password function takes a plain-text password and hashed password as arguments. It then uses the pwd_context object to verify that the plain-text password matches the hashed one.

Parameters:

  • self – Make the function a method of the user class

  • plain_password – Pass the password entered by the user

  • hashed_password – Compare the hashed password in the database with the plain text password entered by user

Returns:

A boolean value

REST API service Email¶

async src.services.email.send_email(email: EmailStr, username: str, host: str)¶

The send_email function sends an email to the user with a link to confirm their email address..

Parameters:

  • email – EmailStr: Specify the email address of the recipient

  • username – str: Personalize the email

  • host – str: Create a link to the frontend

Returns:

A coroutine
